notesStmt.note: Modern restoration, all the folios stuck on modern paper. A long gap after folio 64. Worm-eaten. Lacuna after folio 111. Margins slightly worm-eaten.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Two fragments of Arabic commentaries on the book of Psalms.

collation.p:
11 quires, nos. 2-8, and 11-14, of 10 leaves each. No. 5 has only 5 leaves.
Quires 2, 8, and 11 are defective.
Signatures in Arabic letters on the first page of a quire.
2 quires (folios 104-111), the number of which is uncertain, and no. 8, signed (folios 112-121).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Two different Naskhi hands of the 13th and 14th century. A Naskhi hand of approximately 13th century. A Naskhi hand of approximately 14th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Commentary on Psalms. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2565.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882: inscribed, back flyleaf [i]v.
